newsitem.title: USA: Initial wait ends July 12 for Giddings buy.
newsitem.headline: Initial wait ends July 12 for Giddings buy.

text.p: Giddings & Lewis Inc said Wednesday the initial waiting period for the proposed takeover of the company by Germany's Thyssen AG will expire July 12.

The company said Thyssen was deemed to have filed a premerger notification and report form under the Hart-Scott-Rodino AntiTrust Improvements Act of 1976 with Federal regulators on June 27. Accordingly, the law's waiting period will expire July 12, the company said.
Giddings agreed to be acquired by the German steel and engineering giant Thyssen AG for $675 million June 12.
Thyssen upped a $19-a-share take-over bid by Harnischfeger Industries Inc by two dollars to $21 a share. Giddings had rejected Harnischfeger's bid in May as inadequate.
Giddings stock traded at 20-49/64 Wednesday afternoon, down 3/64.
